Blog.post: Just how did the proposal happen?! Well it was 1st December 2003 and we had just been to see Daniel Beddingfield in concert at Newcastle's City Hall. Before the show I went to buy ice creams and was annoyed when i came back to find him hastily putting his phone back in his pocket - texting one of his friends! Or so i thought.... The concert was amazing and Daniel had also sung "our song", If you're not the one. I had an inkling Paul might propose but when the song finished and we left the building (after Paul bought a commemorative mug!) I felt disappointed and stupid about my inkling that hadn't happened. I mentioned in the car that one of my friends thought he may propose tonight (I couldn't tell him it was me who thought that!)when he brought out his phone - with a text he'd prepared when i'd got the ice creams saying.... "as 'you are the one' will you marry me?" I also found out later that Paul thought it would have been to cheesy to do it after or during the song! No!!!! I told him! But it was special anyway and i said yes immediately. How long have i been waiting!! I took the day after off work and we went shopping for a ring. I wanted something simple so we chose an 18 carat white gold diamond solitaire. It's beautiful! We had a small engagement party on the 10th December at home and received lots of brill pressies and cards - thanks everyone! The picture above is us at paul's mum's after telling her our good news!

Well!! I'm not exactly sure when we first met but i doubt it was fireworks! (well not for Paul anyway!) Paul worked with friends of mine who were always chatting to him when we went out on a girly night, I just stood in awe, too dumbstruck to speak - honest! Anyway, Paula and I were awarding men with medals, shallow I know, but Paul was the only gold medal ever awarded! For about 6 months I was too afraid to speak to him then one (drunken!) night, June 2001, I approached him and muttered something along the lines of "you know my friend Jill - she's just had a baby!" Not surprisingly he looked at me like I was from another planet! We chatted but I thought he was boring, all he could talk about was Pearl Harbour the film, and he yawned a lot - charming! Anyway as the weeks went on we "bumped" into each other in the local hotspot "Mood", and the rest as they say is history. We had a couple of false starts - I dumped him twice but when I took him to Barcelona in February 2002 for his birthday he asked me to move in with him (aw) and we've been inseparable ever since. Hmmmm...........!!
